page.title: 16CITY DEVELOPMENT AND TOURISM
page.content: FROM 1960 ONWARDS A REDESIGNED CENTRAL COMMERCIAL AND SHOPPING AREA ADJACENT TO NEW BUS AND RAIL STATIONS AND MULTI STOREY CAR PARKS WAS BUILT AROUND THE HISTORICAL SITES AND CATHEDRAL TO BRING IN SHOPPERS AND TOURIST TRADE. THE CITY COUNCIL AND CIVIC TRUST ARE EXPLOITING THE HISTORICAL LEGACY. THE WESTGATE RIVERSIDE WAS LANDSCAPED, A BOATING LAKE ADDED CREATING A GARDEN APPROACH TO THE CITY AND CATHEDRAL. PRESERVATION OF HISTORICAL SITES AND SOME CHURCHES HAS BEEN DONE BY CHANGES IN USE - ST.MICHAEL'S TOWER AT THE CROSS IS A TOURIST INFORMATION CENTRE,BISHOP HOOPER'S LODGINGS IS A FOLK MUSEUM. THE FUTURE MARINA WILL HOUSE THE WATERWAYS MUSEUM AND RESTAURANTS AND OTHER LIKE INTERESTS HOUSED IN HISTORIC WAREHOUSE BUILDINGS.MANY PILGRIM INNS EG. FLEECE & NEW INN OFFER GOOD ACCOMMODATION.
